intro: Stenolobium amoenum, commonly known as the white flame tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling flames. The plant is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and it has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. Its bark is smooth and grayish, and it thrives in full sun with well-drained soil. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking floral display.
